name: Aguila de Osa Inn

reviews.text: I stayed at Aguila de Osa early last week for 3 nights and I have to admit I was disappointed. Had nothing to do with the weather. I expected it to be rainy in October. Luckily it only rained all day one day. I think for the amount of money I paid, I expected better service, food and my room was just okay (the bathroom toilet, the seat cover was almost broken off). Unfortunately, if you're looking for a quiet retreat, this place is not for you. It was extremely laid back. Also, there was a lot of construction and repair work going on that kind of cut into the sounds of the surroundings. I felt like I was annoying the manager if I tried to ask her questions. It seemed like she had more time to talk to her friends than with her guests. The food was substantial, and you'd never go hungry, but it was a bit on the salty side for my tastes. It wasn't all disappointing though. Other members of the staff were awesome and extremely friendly and warm. I went snorkeling off of Cano Island (successfully this time) and enjoyed it immensely. Our snorkeling guide, Sandra was great. The view from my room was beautiful and it was cool waking up to the sounds of the Pacific ocean and the chattering birds and geckos (before the sounds of the construction work got started). So, if you're considering Aguila de Osa, it's probably best not to go in October. If you're looking for a laid back, no hands on kind of place, this is the place for you. Unfortunately, it wasn't for me.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.text: Stayed in room 2, room 1 nice too, we had hammocks (other rooms near by did not), and two macaws liked to hang out in tree above our room. Did package deal (4th night free) which cinched the deal over staying at La Paloma Lodge. The grounds were lovely, food quite good served family style with wine allowing all the guests to get to know each other. The bartender was replaced with a beginner so the drinks suffered somewhat after the first night. Excursions to Cano Island-ok-would likely skip next time, snorkeling only ok and a diver friend gave the dive a 4/10 (but has been to great barrier reef 3x rates 10/10), went twice to Corcovado park with guide, Tony, nice tours, but a little short, 2-3 hrs hiking time for the price 75-100. Guests can hike along a shore trail for miles, there is a tiny town that just got electricity 4 months ago. The free kayaks were fun to paddle around and there are some small waves to surf in bay.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and amazing area
Osa Paradise
reviews.text: The manager was nice but really mellow and not as forthcoming with activity info as everywhere else I went, resort has really low-key feeling, and management style seemed a little less professional than other places I visited, (the support staff did not have identifying shirts/uniforms, and seemed to hang out a lot, not sure if they were suppose to be working (to ask questions), off work, locals?), so ended up just figuring out what you wanted to do, ie take out a kayak, find the paddle, drag it down to the dock)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights at Aguila in late February and had a wonderful time. I totally agree with Birdfinder's review. If you're looking for an out of the way spot to relax, hike, bird, or fish, then this is the place. Brad, Pedro, Carlos, Anita and the entire gang took great care of us. I would recommend staying at least 4 nights. There are way too many opportunities to explore to visit for less. I highly recommend the Mangrove tour with Carlos. And hang on to you napkin at dinner time. Coco (Brad's puppy) will have you playing tug-of-war in no time.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aguila de Osa for four nights and can definitely recommend it. As for the rooms, we enjoyed many long hours on our veranda birdwatching and soaking up the spectacular ocean view. We also had a great time kayaking, hiking, and birding the area. Since we were there mainly to bird, we didn't do any diving or fishing, so we can't comment on those. But the resident bird guide (Carlos), who took us on a number of very productive birding trips, and on the mangrove tour, was passionate and top notch. Also, the owner of the lodge, Bradd, is a laid back guy who takes very good care of his guests. He was always around to chat with during the evening cocktail hour, and cooked up a seriously good lentil soup for a few of us vegetarians. Yep, even the owner jumps into the kitchen now and then at Aguila! In fact, all of the food was excellent (including the meat and fish dishes according the carnivores in our party!). Finally, Bradd and his lodge are highly active in regional conservation projects (including Corcovado) and in local education programs. But he can tell you all about that over a cocktail when you get there.
reviews.title: Wonderful jungle experience
Wonderful stay (but you have to be into "family style" meals)
reviews.text: My husband and 2 adult children recently returned from a trip to Costa Rica beginning with 3 days at the Aquila de Osa Inn. We arrived at the Palmar Sur airport from San Jose then transferred to a van for a 20 minute ride to the boat dock and another hour by boat to the lodge. There is a new airport at Drake Bay which would be a quicker journey to the lodge, but flights are very limited at this point and the airstrip is basically just a strip of dirt! Worth checking into if you plan on coming though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with what everyone else is writing for the most part. We found the area and lodge very charming. Long walk up hill to rooms that overlook the beautiful bay and ocean. Rooms are basic but roomy with screen windows and ceiling fans that provide some respite to a very hot, muggy climate with little breeze. (A swimming pool would have been nice) We were in rooms 6 & 7 and had problems with erratic hot water which I heard is an ongoing problem. Not that I minded a cold shower but it's the principle when you're paying fairly steep prices. Meals were very good, served family style which provided a great opportunity to meet people from around the world and share stories. The hike into the Corcovado Rain Forest was good although challenging (slippery) to the waterfall. In addition to hiking boots try to bring a pair of water shoes to change into as you get closer to the fall. The animal viewing was just OK at Corcovado. Nature is so hit and miss. People the day before saw the sloths but we never saw them. Saw monkeys at the inn and also along the river while kayaking, which is a must-do activity. The trip to Cano Island on day 2 was great. The snorkeling was very good and my husband and son had 2 great dives. For the Pacific Ocean they thought the visibility was quite good and saw mantas, turtles, sharks and loads of fish. I was fascinated by the millions of hermit crabs on the shore of the island. Yes, the boats do come with the tourists mid-morning but it's not out of control and there were quieter areas to relax in. After Drake BAy we continued on to Manuel Antonio and to Arenal which was great but our favorite place was Drake Bay and Aquila because of the quaint and unique experience. But it may not be like that in 5 years so go soon! We can't wait to return to Costa Rica!
reviews.title: Amazing!!!
Beautiful, full of adventure, or quiet -whatever you make it.
reviews.text: This hotel is not for everyone, but if you want a laid back experience -one that reminds you that you are on vacation to relax, in an underdeveloped country , then this is for you.

To get to Aguila de Osa you have to fly a puddle jumper 40 minutes from San Jose and then take a boat down a river, into the ocean and across the bay. By then you should be relaxed and ready for anything. Along the way, your skipper will point out crocodiles, monkeys, birds, dolfins, whatever is around -and a ton is around.
reviews.title: Gorgeous place
Terrible service!
reviews.text: The rooms are large cabins on top of a hill, almost in the canopy.
The staff puts coffee outside of your room around 5am -and you may wake up to monkeys stealing the sugar from the cups.
reviews.title: Worth every penny and will go back
Disappointing
reviews.text: look forward to lounging in your hamock while watching iguanas and toucans in the trees. (request a cabin w/a hamock -not all have them)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My beautiful new bride and I spent a wonderful 2 weeks in CR, each place better than the last and our final 4 were in the paradise of Drake Bay at Aguila de Osa. Even the experience getting to the resort was great - river trip out to the Pacific back in to the Bay! From the minute we got there were were greeted by friendly staff, macaws, complimentary beverages, and great views wherever we looked. Spent a few days snorkeling including right from their secluded beach and some jungle tours, saw dolphins and whales and monkeys and gators and lizards and all kinds of neat tropical plants. The owner was pretty laid back, had lots of great stories and his dog would lead us anywhere we wanted to go! DEFINITELY would recommend for a honeymoon or romantic getaway, you can be as active or lazy as you want. Rooms all have great views, open air, very comfortable. Only downside for some may be the 50-60 steps up from the dining room to get to the rooms.
reviews.title: best trip of my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here was exceptional. The food was delicious, the rooms were very clean and the lanscaping was beautifull. They even invited us into town where we partied till 4am. I definetely will return to the Aguila De Osa. We saw a tremendous amount of animals while in Drake Bay, it was so nice coming back to a nice lodge after tromping through the jungle.
reviews.title: Jungle Paradise

likes.disliked: — The Stairs. Tico's Love Thier Stairs

reviews.text: Our two boys, 16 and 13, were reluctant to join us ("No TV? No phones in the room?") but they were mesmerized as were we with the remarkable location and the beauty of the nature around them. You experience this unique ecosystem literally from your own room and balcony, and are surrounded by plants, flowers, and other living things. We spent 4 days at Aguila de Osa which honestly was enough, but more time would not be a loss. Snorkeling, rainforest hikes, boating, zip lines and more. Food was fresh, simple and tasteful. A little hot at night for those of us used to AC, but the fans are adequate and we hit a hot spell. Fresh coffee outside of our room at 5AM each morning, incredibly friendly service (we never saw a frown) and all in all everything we needed was taken care of. Highly recommended. Caution: we then went North to the Marriot Los Suenos for a few days and although we were not disappointed, it is a resort like many others, and not a terribly unique experience. Aguila is something else!
reviews.title: Even My Teenagers Loved It

reviews.text: We (myself, my wife and daughters 14 & 17)stayed 4 nights at Aquila and everything was fantastic. We went on the snorkeling trip to Cano Island, on the Mangrove boat tour and on the San Pedrillo hike in Corcorvado. We saw birds, anteaters, sloths, snakes, bugs, bats, fish and beautiful vegetation. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The food was delicious. Dinner is family style with 2 meats - chicken / beef / fish while we were there, salad or soup, rice, veggies, bread, desert. The guides were extremely knowledgeable regarding birds and wildlife.
reviews.title: Fantastic Everything

reviews.text: We had no problem with the water or mosquitoes and while it was certainly hot during the day, the place is designed to make the most of breezes and fans. And the nights were very pleasant for sleeping. Be ready to wake up early because the birds are out in force around 5:30. Not much shopping. No other bars or nightlife – Aguila is ‘out-there’ and that’s its beauty. Time passes differently there – we all noticed it. We plan to go back someday. It's a tropical paradise.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

aka: Aguila De Osa Hotel Drake Bay
